publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7653 Jackie Baillie: Bangladesh Bonus for Aggreko—That the Parliament congratulates Dumbarton-based Aggreko on securing a £114 million contract to supply power to Bangladesh over a three year period; understands that Aggreko is the world leader in temporary power solutions and was selected to provide 150 megawatts of emergency gas-power for the Bangladesh Power Development Board; notes that Aggreko employs more than 4,000 people worldwide, including around 120 in Dumbarton; further notes that a further 110 jobs are likely to be created when Aggreko relocates to its new £20 million purpose-built base at Lomondgate in 2011, and commends Aggreko for adding yet another project to a list that includes the Beijing Olympics, the 2010 World Cup and the inauguration of US President Barack Obama.

S3M-7653 Jackie Baillie: Bangladesh Bonus for Aggreko—That the Parliament congratulates Dumbarton-based Aggreko on securing a £114 million contract to supply power to Bangladesh over a three year period; understands that Aggreko is the world leader in temporary power solutions and was selected to provide 150 megawatts of emergency gas-power for the Bangladesh Power Development Board; notes that Aggreko employs more than 4,000 people worldwide, including around 120 in Dumbarton; further notes that a further 110 jobs are likely to be created when Aggreko relocates to its new £20 million purpose-built base at Lomondgate in 2011, and commends Aggreko for adding yet another project to a list that includes the Beijing Olympics, the 2010 World Cup and the inauguration of US President Barack Obama. Supported by: Jamie McGrigor*, Des McNulty*, Helen Eadie*
S3M-7653 Bangladesh Bonus for Aggreko (lodged on 22 December 2010) Mary Mulligan*, David Whitton*, Hugh Henry*
S3M-7653 Bangladesh Bonus for Aggreko (lodged on 22 December 2010) Stuart McMillan*

S3M-7653 Jackie Baillie: Bangladesh Bonus for Aggreko—That the Parliament congratulates Dumbarton-based Aggreko on securing a £114 million contract to supply power to Bangladesh over a three year period; understands that Aggreko is the world leader in temporary power solutions and was selected to provide 150 megawatts of emergency gas-power for the Bangladesh Power Development Board; notes that Aggreko employs more than 4,000 people worldwide, including around 120 in Dumbarton; further notes that a further 110 jobs are likely to be created when Aggreko relocates to its new £20 million purpose-built base at Lomondgate in 2011, and commends Aggreko for adding yet another project to a list that includes the Beijing Olympics, the 2010 World Cup and the inauguration of US President Barack Obama. Supported by: Jamie McGrigor, Des McNulty, Helen Eadie, Mary Mulligan, David Whitton, Hugh Henry, Stuart McMillan
